entry.title: Managing Fonts in WordPress Block Themes
entry.summary: Fonts are a defining characteristic of the design of any site. That includes WordPress themes, where itâ€™s common for theme developers to integrate a service like Google Fonts into the WordPress Customizer settings for a â€œclassicâ€ PHP-based theme. That hasnâ€™t â€¦ Managing Fonts in WordPress Block Themes originally published on CSS-Tricks, which is part of the DigitalOcean family. You should get the newsletter.

entry.title: 20 more text tools
entry.summary: Team Browserling keeps shipping! Last week we added 50 new text tools. This week we added 20 more tools to our Online Text Tools collection. Add Symbols Around Each Letter Insert Symbols Between All Letters Swap Adjacent Letters in Words Remove Random Letters from Words Remove Random Symbols from Text Add Prefix to Words Add Suffix to Words Remove Prefix from Words Remove Suffix from Words Add Prefix to Text Lines Add Suffix to Text Lines Remove Prefix from Text Lines Remove Suffix from Text Lines Unwrap Text Lines Add Strikethrough to Text Add Symbols Around Words Remove Symbols From Around Words Replace Vowels in Words Duplicate Vowels in Words Remove Vowels from Words Replace Consonants in Words Duplicate Consonants in Words Remove Consonants from Words Next week we'll add 10 more tools. See you then!

entry.title: Should you send marketing emails on weekends?
entry.summary: At Browserling and Online Tools, we ran an experiment to see if it was worth sending marketing emails on weekends. It turned out weekends had very good open rates for personal email addresses (@gmail, @yahoo, @hotmail, @outlook, etc) but no open rates for business emails (all other non-@gmail etc addresses). So from now on we're sending marketing emails to businesses only on weekdays but to everyone else we send marketing emails on all days of the week, including Saturdays and Sundays. See you next time!
